title: Google, iHeartMedia Pay $9 Million to Settle Deceptive Endorsement Claims
description: Google and iHeartMedia agreed to settle allegations by state and federal authorities that the companies used deceptive endorsements by radio personalities to promote Google’s Pixel 4 phones.

title: Musk Attacks Apple and Its CEO Over Advertising, Censorship
description: Elon Musk criticized Apple and CEO Tim Cook for allegedly withdrawing most of its advertising spending on Twitter.

title: Elon Musk's Boring Company Ghosts Cities Across America
description: The tunnel venture has repeatedly teased local officials with a pledge to ‘solve soul-destroying traffic,’ and then backed out when confronted with the realities of building public infrastructure.

title: BlockFi Files for Bankruptcy as Latest Crypto Casualty
description: Cryptocurrency lender BlockFi filed for bankruptcy, making it the latest major digital assets company to fail since FTX, with which BlockFi is financially intertwined.

title: Investors Are Losing Patience With Driverless Cars' Slow Pace
description: Investors are getting impatient with the pace of driverless-car development, pressuring an industry that has had to scale back plans and retrench.

title: Meta Fined $276 Million in Europe for Data-Scraping Leak
description: The fine issued by Ireland’s Data Protection Commission, Meta’s main privacy regulator in the European Union, is the latest sign of how authorities in the region are becoming more aggressive in applying the bloc’s privacy law to big technology companies.

title: Cyber Insurers Turn Attention to Catastrophic Hacks
description: While cyber insurance has evolved significantly in recent years, insurers say they might still be unprepared for the fallout from a catastrophic cyberattack.

title: JPMorgan, Others in Talks to Reimburse Zelle Customers
description: U.S. banks including JPMorgan Chase and Wells Fargo are devising a plan to compensate victims of scams on the Zelle payment network.

title: Bahamian Attorney General Defends Handling of FTX Collapse
description: Island nation’s leaders are under pressure after encouraging cryptocurrency companies to do business there in recent years.
